DataElement.preferredName: Acetaminophen Administered Twice Weekly Month or more Frequency Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Indicator to signify whether Acetaminophen was taken twice weekly for a month or more

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A drug that reduces pain and fever (but not inflammation).  It belongs to the family of drugs called analgesics._The act of having given something (e.g., a medication or test).

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A drug that reduces pain and fever (but not inflammation).  It belongs to the family of drugs called analgesics.

Concepts.definition: A p-aminophenol derivative with analgesic and antipyretic activities. Although the exact mechanism through which acetaminophen exert its effects has yet to be fully determined, acetaminophen may inhibit the nitric oxide (NO) pathway mediated by a variety of neurotransmitter receptors including N-methyl-D-aspartate (NMDA) and substance P, resulting in elevation of the pain threshold. The antipyretic activity may result from inhibition of prostaglandin synthesis and release in the central nervous system (CNS) and prostaglandin-mediated effects on the heat-regulating center in the anterior hypothalamus.
The act of having given something (e.g., a medication or test).

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: A category of organic or inorganic substances, elements, and isotopes used in research or for the prevention, diagnosis, and/or treatment of disease states. Includes biologically active substances that are either synthetically manufactured or endogenous substances extracted and processed to be reintroduced into an organism. Chemicals and drugs also include hazardous substances, and naturally occurring or synthetically produced substances required to maintain life.

ValueDomain.preferredName: Twice Weekly Month or more Frequency Indicator
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Two times per week._A statement about the relative size or order of two objects specifying that either both objects are the same in quantity or measure or value or status or that the object of interest exceeds the other object in one of these ways._One of the 12 divisions of a year as determined by a calendar.  It corresponds to the unit of time of approximately to one cycle of the moon's phases, about 30 days or 4 weeks._The number of occurrences of something within a given time period. (NCI)_An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The answer is not known by the person answering.

Concepts.definition: A statement about the relative size or order of two objects specifying that either both objects are the same in quantity or measure or value or status or that the object of interest exceeds the other object in one of these ways.
One of the 12 divisions of a year as determined by a calendar. It corresponds to the unit of time of approximately to one cycle of the moon's phases, about 30 days or 4 weeks.
The number of occurrences of something within a given time period.

An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

ReferenceDocuments.name: Have you ever taken acetamino
ReferenceDocuments.description: Have you ever taken acetaminophen-based  medications at least 2 times a week for a month or more?  Examples are Tylenol, Anacin-3 and Panadol.
